title: The Best Advice You Can Get - A Conversation with Colin
description:
Get everything early here: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=gameovergreggy

This video was edited on an ORIGIN PC EVO15-S Laptop. Get you PC here www.ORIGINPC.com.


Buy our shirts! http://www.districtlines.com/gameovergreggy

Each and every Friday, Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, Nick Scarpino, and Tim Gettys get together to talk. Each podcaster brings a topic to the table, and then, they go. TV, space, books, movies -- anything goes.

Follow us on Twitter!
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys

transcript_chunks.text: I guess the worst advice I ever got was, "Oh, these student loans aren't that big of a deal. You'd be fine." What's up everybody? Welcome to A Conversation with Colin. I'm Greg Miller, and this is my roommate Colin Moriarty. Now sometimes Colin says crazy stuff. So thanks for your support on Patreon.com/KindaFunny. We're doing a final season of me reaching to the random TAC-P pulling one out, tossing it at them lovingly, and then talking about it for your amusement if you like that. Like this video? Support us on Patreon. Subscribe to our channel. Share us with your friends. Colin, are you ready? Yes. Today's topic of conversation is what is the best or worst advice you've ever gotten from an old school friend? Uh, I'm not sure what the worst advice I've ever gotten was because I'd really have to delve deep into my mind for that. But I can tell you what the best advice ever given to me was. Okay, uh... and I got it over and over again as I grew up: "None of this matters right now because you're young."

to delve deep into the mind for that, but I can tell you what the best advice ever is. Okay, uh, and I got it over and over again as I grew up. None of this matters right now because you're young and stupid, and you're not going to care about any of this in the future. That really was true, and however that was delivered to me as a kid, as a youth, as a teenager, even my early 20s - where they'd be like, "You don't know what love is; it'll be all right." You know? Or, "High school's dumb; you're just a kid. It won't matter." And well, they were almost every time that that was delivered to me from whoever that was delivered from absolutely right. Yeah, I agree with that. And so if you're young and dumb and watching this, that is 100% correct. But as someone who's young and dumb, I know how hard that is to accept. I remember when I fell in love in college, and I was like, "I'm going to marry this girl." And everyone's like, "You are too young to get married; you don't know." And I'm like, "Ah, you don't know"

Is to accept, I remember when I fell in love in college, and I was like, "I'm going to marry this girl," and everyone's like, "You're too young to get married; you don't know." And I'm like, "Ah, you don't know." That was something. And then here I am divorced. Yeah, I mean it's true, man. Like, it is hard in the time to accept how dumb you are and how stupid you are. We're all dumb, and we're all stupid when we're that age. It's just... when I think about 16-year-old Colin or 18-year-old Colin, I just cringe. Oh God, you're so dumb; you know? Like, you thought you were smart, but you were really, really dumb. And uh, you might have been book smart or something like that, but like in terms of the things I was worried about, the things I was doing, and people maybe some of the people I was hanging out with or things I was really wrapped up about—it was irrelevant; it was totally irrelevant. And uh, so I think that's a really sound piece of advice that you should listen to in the moment.

out with or things I was really wrapped up about it was irrelevant, it was totally irrelevant, and uh so I think that that's a really sound piece of advice uh that you should listen to in the moment because it'll make you feel better as opposed to being resistant to it and then 10 years later realizing oh you're were absolutely right yeah yeah you got to it's at some point you have to understand from people you respect that they're giving you good advice and you need to surrender that control absolutely or at least weigh that in your decision making process absolutely now now that I'm 30 I don't think that that's a relevant thing that people can say to me anymore but I don't think it was irrelevant until a couple years ago like like I think that I only really became a real adult as many people I think do years removed from college and kind of having your feet underneath you so I think that that the best piece of advice I got over and over again was hey man don't worry about it it's it's

I think years removed from college and kind of having your feet underneath you so I think that that the best piece of advice I got over and over again was hey man don't worry about it it's it's water under the bridge you're not you're going to look back at this and laugh you're going to look back at this and not care this traumatic breakup this terrible thing that happened to you that's **** ruining your life right now will not even matter at all and you won't even think about it ever again right and they right yeah I mean the best advice I think I ever got is that the worst situations will become the best stories you know what I mean and like granted that pays off for us talking to you talking on a Game Over Greg show doing everything else but like when I slid down the slide and cried when I was on Pirates of the Caribbean crying and all the other traumatic events when I pooped in front of Tim Gettys and this random person who was outside like these things happen and at the time

cried when I was on Pirates of the Caribbean crying and all the other traumatic events when I pooped in front of you and this random person who was outside like these things happen and at the time they're mortifying but if you accept that one day they'll be all right it'll be a funny story you'll be okay yeah absolutely I guess the worst advice I ever got was oh these student loans aren't that big of a deal you'd be fine thanks that was what would you what would you have done in if you could go back now nothing you can't do with me you got to go to college no it was worth it I mean that experience was worth it but man crushing are those student loans you know they're getting better now yeah but I remember when I first got my student loan bill in 2007 my first won I like I started crying I was like how am I going to pay for any of this like I can't afford I like literally can't afford to pay for this what was I doing why did I spend all this money on and then 10 years later you're like

was like how am I going to pay for any of this like I can't afford I like literally can't afford to pay for this what was I doing why did I spend all this money on and then 10 years later you're like I'll figure it out I'll quit my job and I'll I'll go host a successful YouTube channel that'll pay him off like that oh absolutely the money will roll away oh no doubt about it I'm going to be rich that's you in the money um I paid it down like halfway I guess and it's it's getting better now but man that was that's a rough that's be very careful out there with your student loan yeah um you don't necessarily have to go to a private university no you go to great great public I mean I'm very proud of going to Northeastern it's an awesome school I could have gone somewhere else probably yeah but I can say I went to Northeastern and that's basically what I paid for so great that was totally worth it all right some more good advice from Colin there you go
